title: Changing Units and the Effect It Has on Correlation
question_text:
The correlation between distance (in kilometers) and airfare (in dollars) is $0.8$.
If we were to change the distance to be measured to miles (all the values in the distance will therefore be divided by $1.61$), what effect will this have on the correlation?

choices.text:
The correlation will decrease by
0.5
, making the new correlation
0.3
.
Since only the distance measurements have changed, the correlation will decrease significantly.
Because changing units does not affect the correlation, the correlation will remain the same.

correct_answer: The correct answer is Choice 'E'. Changing the units of variables does not change the correlation coefficient “r,” because we get rid of all our units when we standardize (get z-scores). The standardization allows us to compare correlations between data sets where variables are measured in different units or when variables are different.
